autocogs 0.1.4

Cog group data frame

Source: R/add_layer_cogs_.R
cog_group.Rd

Make a cog group data frame to be passed into add_layer_cogs()

cog_group(...)

Arguments

...

sets of three values to fill in 'cog_group', 'cols', and 'name'

Examples

cog_group(
  "univariate_discrete", "x", "_x",
  "univariate_counts", "x", "_n"
)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 3
#>   cog_group           cols      name 
#>   <chr>               <list>    <chr>
#> 1 univariate_discrete <chr [1]> _x   
#> 2 univariate_counts   <chr [1]> _n   
cog_group(
  "univariate_continuous", "x", "_x",
  "univariate_continuous", "y", "_y",
  "bivariate_continuous", c("x", "y"), "_bivar",
  "scagnostics", c("x", "y"), "_scagnostic",
  "bivariate_counts", c("x", "y"), "_n"
)
#> # A tibble: 5 × 3
#>   cog_group             cols      name       
#>   <chr>                 <list>    <chr>      
#> 1 univariate_continuous <chr [1]> _x         
#> 2 univariate_continuous <chr [1]> _y         
#> 3 bivariate_continuous  <chr [2]> _bivar     
#> 4 scagnostics           <chr [2]> _scagnostic
#> 5 bivariate_counts      <chr [2]> _n
